lenders.occupational_info: Eddie & Kolleena live in Memphis, Tennessee, a city located on the banks of the Mississippi River and the birthplace of rock'n'roll music.  Eddie is a federal public defender, representing people charged with federal crimes who cannot afford to hire an attorney on their own.  Eddie loves his work because it allows him to use his blessings of education and social-economic position to help ensure that the constitutional rights of our fellow citizens are protected when the federal government seeks to take their liberty.  Kolleena is a special education teacher, which means she spends her day with students who need extra attention in order to learn.  Kolleena receives great fulfillment from her work because, although it takes great effort, her students demonstrate tangible signs of progress each day.

We then share the information and "stories" with media, editors and bloggers around the world to trigger their interest. My work is mainly done on the computer, but I am fortunate to meet a lot of very bright people with great ideas in Silicon Valley and throughout the world. We also help these bright people to raise money and get the attention of Venture Capitalist so they can grow their business. I support the Soroptimist International of San Francisco, Founded in 1921, Soroptimist comprises almost 100,000 members in about 120 countries and territories worldwide who contribute time and financial support to community-based projects benefiting women. Soroptimist's major service project, the Women's Opportunity Awards program, provides cash grants for women seeking to improve their economic situation through additional education and training. Soroptimist International is a non-governmental organization with Category 1 status at the United Nations. For more information about how Soroptimist makes a difference for women, you can also go to www.soroptimist.org

The bank won't lend him the money because they can't be bothered doing business on such a small scale. Luckily there is another kind of financial institution that can connect him with ordinary folk who happen to be blessed with more money than they need and the realization that they are lucky to be in that situation. So the fellow gets his gear. Groups like Kiva are the other kind of financial organization. You and I are the lucky and you know it. If you aren't already doing your part what are you waiting for?

lenders.name: Steve Hayhurst
lenders.loan_because:
I'm sure many of you participating  with KIVA have heard of the Starfish Story.  In this instance,  I want to be like that Old Man, Peace.

-- The Starfish Story --

A young man is walking along the ocean and sees a
beach on which thousands and thousands of starfish
have washed ashore. Further along he sees an old 
man, walking slowly and stooping often, picking up one
starfish after another and tossing each one gently
into the ocean. 

"Why are you throwing starfish into the ocean?," he
asks.

"Because the sun is up and the tide is going out and
if I don't throw them further in they will die."

"But, old man, don't you realize there are miles and
miles of beach and starfish all along it! You can't
possibly save them all, you can't even save one-tenth
of them. In fact, even if you work all day, your
efforts won't make any difference at all."

The old man listened calmly and then bent down to pick
up another starfish and gently tossed it into the sea. "It
made a difference to that one."

Thank you to KIVA staff,  to all the KIVA lenders and recipients for making this a better world.

The Social Entrepreneurs of Grinnell
(SEG) seek to foster mutually
